contentrichtext.text: {{Other people|Michael Clark}} {{BLP sources|date=January 2011}} {{Infobox MP |honorific-prefix = |name = Michael Clark |honorific-suffix = |image = |constituency_MP = [[Rayleigh (UK Parliament constituency)|Rayleigh]]<br /><small>[[Rochford (UK Parliament constituency)|Rochford]] (1983-1997)</small> |parliament = |majority = |term_start = 9 June 1983 |term_end = 7 June 2001 |predecessor = [[Boundary Commissions (United Kingdom)|Constituency Established]] |successor = [[Mark Francois]] |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1935|08|8|df=yes}} |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |birthname = |nationality = [[United Kingdom|British]] |party = [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] |otherparty = |spouse = |relations = |children = |residence = |alma_mater = [[King's College London]]<br>[[University of Minnesota]]<br>[[St John's College, Cambridge]] |occupation = |profession = |cabinet = |committees = |portfolio = |religion = |signature = }} '''Michael Clark''' (born 8 August 1935) is a British [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] politician.<ref>http://www.theyworkforyou.com/mp/michael_clark/rayleigh</ref> He was educated at [[Retford Oaks High School|King Edward VI Grammar School, Retford]] and [[King's College London]] where he graduated with a BSc in Chemistry in 1956, and subsequently studied at the [[University of Minnesota]] before completing a PhD in Chemistry at [[St John's College, Cambridge]] in 1960. He served as [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative Party]] Member of Parliament for [[Rochford (UK Parliament constituency)|Rochford]] from 1983 until 1997, and for [[Rayleigh (UK Parliament constituency)|Rayleigh]] from 1997 until he stood down at the [[United Kingdom general election, 2001|2001 general election]]. He is a [[Fellowship of King's College London|Fellow]] of his alma mater, [[King's College London]]. The current Speaker of the House of Commons, [[John Bercow]] MP, began his Parliamentary career working as a researcher for Michael Clark.<ref>http://www.w4mp.org/html/library/2010booklet/speaker.asp</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-par|uk}} {{succession box | title = [[Member of Parliament]] for [[Rochford (UK Parliament constituency)|Rochford]] | years = [[United Kingdom general election, 1983|1983]]–[[United Kingdom general election, 1997|1997]] | before = New Constituency | after = Constituency Abolished }} {{succession box | title = [[Member of Parliament]] for [[Rayleigh (UK Parliament constituency)|Rayleigh]] | years = [[United Kingdom general election, 1997|1997]]–[[United Kingdom general election, 2001|2001]] | before = New Constituency | after = [[Mark Francois]] }} {{s-end}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Clark, Michael | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = British politician | DATE OF BIRTH =8 August 1935 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Clark, Michael}} [[Category:1935 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Alumni of King's College London]] [[Category:Fellows of King's College London]] [[Category:University of Minnesota alumni]] [[Category:Alumni of St John's College, Cambridge]] [[Category:Members of the United Kingdom Parliament for English constituencies]] [[Category:Conservative Party (UK) MPs]] [[Category:UK MPs 1983–1987]] [[Category:UK MPs 1987–1992]] [[Category:UK MPs 1992–1997]] [[Category:UK MPs 1997–2001]] [[Category:People educated at King Edward VI Grammar School, Retford]] {{Conservative-UK-MP-1930s-stub}}
